intro: Goniothalamus kunstleri var. tomentosus, commonly known as the hairy goniothalamus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in lowland rainforests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
